verses.verse: "For the Kingdom of Heaven is like a man [who is] a landowner and went out early in the morning to hire workers for his vineyard.
"When he had made an agreement with the workers for a denarius a day, he sent them into his vineyard.
"He went out about the third hour [about 0900 AM] and saw others standing unemployed in the marketplace,
"and he said to them: «You go also into the vineyard and whatever is right, I will give you,» and they went out.
"Again he went out about the sixth [noon] and the ninth [3 PM] hour and did the same.
"Around the eleventh hour [5 PM] he went out and found others standing unemployed and said to them, «Why did you stand here all day unemployed?»
"They said to him, «Because no man has hired us.» He said to them, «You go also into the vineyard, and whatever is right you will receive.»
"So when evening came the lord of the vineyard said to his steward, Call the workers and give them their pay starting from the last to the first.»
"When those who were [hired] about the eleventh hour came, each one received a denarius.
"Now when the first came, they assumed they would get more, but each one likewise received a denarius.
"When they had received it, they complained about the landowner,
"saying: «These last have only worked one hour, and you have made them equal to us who carried the burden and heat of the day.»
"But he answered one of them and said, «Friend, I didn't do you any wrong. Didn't you agree with me for a denarius?»
«Take yours, and go. I will give to the last, even as you.
«Isn't it lawful for me to do what I want with my own? Is your eye malicious, because I am good?»
"So the last will be first and the first last, for many are called but few chosen."
Jesus going up to Jerusalem took the twelve disciples aside on the road and said to them,
"Look, we are going to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be betrayed to the chief priests and scribes, and they will condemn him to die.
"They will deliver him to the Gentiles to mock, scourge, and to crucify, but the third day, he will rise again."
Then the mother of Zebedee's children came with her sons worshiping and desiring certain things from him.
And he said to her, "What do you want?" She said to him, "Grant that these two sons of mine may sit one on your right hand and the other on the left in your kingdom."

But Jesus answered and said, "You don't know what you are asking. Are you able to drink from the cup that I will drink from and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?" They said to him, "We are able."

And he said to them, "You will truly drink from my cup and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with, but to sit on my right hand or on my left is not mine to give, but for those to whom it is prepared by my Father."
When the ten heard it, they were extremely angry against the two brothers.
But Jesus called to them and said, "You know that the princes of the Gentiles wield power over them, and those who are great, wield power over them.
"But it is not to be so among you. Whosoever wants to be great among you, then let him be your servant.
"And whosoever wants to be chief among you, then let him be your slave.
"Even as the Son of Man didn't come to be served but instead to serve and to give his life a ransom for many."
As they left Jericho, a great crowd followed him.
And look, two blind men were sitting by the roadside. When they heard that Jesus passed by, they shouted saying, "Have mercy on us, O Lord, Son of David."
The crowd told them off, because they should shut up, but they shouted even more saying, "Have mercy on us, O Lord, Son of David."
Jesus stopped and called for them and said, "What do you want for me to do for you?"
They said to him, "Lord, that our eyes may be opened."
So Jesus had compassion and touched their eyes. Immediately their eyes received sight, and they followed him.
